medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital hypothyroidism (CH) due to thyroid hypoplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 was diagnosed during neonatal screening for CH with a TSH level of about 200 mU/mL. Symptoms developed in the immediate neonatal period, with persistent jaundice noted. At day 32, TSH levels remained elevated above 100 mU/L, with very low free T4 and T3.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 2, the mother of patient 1, was diagnosed with athyreosis at 9 months of age and has been on l-thyroxine therapy since. She has a history of deafness due to meningitis but does not exhibit signs of mental retardation.
medical_history.family_history: The case involves a familial occurrence of congenital hypothyroidism with mother and daughter affected, suggesting autosomal dominant inheritance.
